Content:: The Sri Lanka Interbank Payment System, commonly known as SLIPS, is a LKR-only online interbank payment and fund transfer system in Sri Lanka.[1][2] SLIPS is owned by LankaClear, an organization owned by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and all Licensed Commercial Banks operating in Sri Lanka, with 47.19% of shares held by the CBSL and State owned commercial banks, and 52.81% by other private banks. SLIPS transfers are designed primarily for catering low-value payments up to LKR 5 million (equivalent to approximately US$36,000).[1][2]  This bank, insurance, or other financial services corporation article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
Title: Sri Lanka Interbank Payment System - Wikipedia
